Reviews.Title: “A complete family hotel”
Reviews.Author: gauravs2005
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Dubai for sometime. Hence, I know it by experience, that finding an affordable hotel in Bur Dubai where one can stay with parents could be a bit tricky if you know what i mean. Its a hotel apartment, which means that its best suited for long stays. And I have stayed for around 90 days altogether in this hotel over a period of time. Apparently, the management is from Pakistan. Hence, the food at the restaurant is mostly Pakistani cuisine. And what Yummm!!! food they serve. I just love the biryani there. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms clean. Unlike most of the hotel apartments in Dubai (in this price range), the rooms are cleaned daily. In most of the other hotel apartments, the rooms are cleaned at max thrice a week. The location is superb. Its right on the bank street (upmarket heart of Bur Dubai), opposite Bur Juman Mall, and right next to the Metro Station. Taxis are available 24x7. Since its a mix of commercial and residential hub, most of the amenities are at stone's throw distance away. Overall, a nice, elegant, economical, family hotel. The staff is courteous. Room service is just about ok. I do not really understand one thing about most of the hotels in Dubai - their fascination with darkness, or rather lack of light. There are hardly any lights in the rooms of most of the hotels. If one is planning to read a book, its a killer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value in hot & pricey Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ked999
Reviews.Content: great studio apartment 70USD on wotif.com (time of year). My treat to myself after 1 month backpacking in Iran, Lebanon, Syria. Located in Bur Dubia - a metro ride from the expense Las Vegas bright lights of Dubia. Efficient, clean, friendly enough, great room. Roof top swimming pool lovely to cool down in the early night. Metro station at the door. Great variety of local eating places scattered around the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Economical comfort if you plan to be mostly outbound!”
Reviews.Author: AshuRadhu
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Moon Valley Hotel Appartments was an economical and a convinient option for us. Its very close to the Bur Dubai Mall and is well connected with the Train service. Hence resulted into a convinient location. However, the check-in wait was really killing as we had travelled from Abu Dhabi to this location and had a small kid of 2 years with us. Also there was some foul smell in the room which originated from the kitchenette. But, it did not bother us much as we were mostly out of the room touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “What it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Antequerana
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a conveniently located Dubai hotel, that's moderately priced, this is a good option. Right next to a metro stop and within walking distance of Dubai's historic Creek neighbourhood, the Moon Valley rooms are large and comfortable, if a little lacking in finishing touches. Our apartment kitchen was a bit worn, but the bed was large and comfy, and the bathroom clean and spacious. Breakfast is pretty average, but no different to many hotels in this part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but dated.”
Reviews.Author: paulino636
Reviews.Content: The Moon Valley Hotel Apartments. In three words: “Adequate, but dated”. But yes, I would stay here again. The reasons I booked this room is as a one-night stayover on my way to Bangkok; I wanted a place that was by the Metro, and affordable. The place delivered with both of these qualities. After basking the blue light of the Khalid Bin Al-Waleed metro station, and surfacing from Exit 4, you see the hotel almost right away. At the time I was there, I needed to cross a sandy, vacant lot. The lobby was quaint, but empty. It did not seem like the type of hotel you would spend time in the lobby, just hanging out. That said though, it was very quiet. Check in was quick and efficient, took less than five minutes. The rooms were quite large, and in the pictures I have, looks sumptuous. Once you get in closer though, you can see the furniture and other fixtures are quite old. There is a kitchenette in the place too. I found some food on one of the “unused” cups though. Also, there was some mildew in the bathroom. The TV was tiny, probably 45 cm or so, and a tube TV, not a flat screen. I didn’t know there were any tube TVs out there anymore. This place just needs a makeover. Bottom line: If you are looking for a place to lay your head, and don’t plan on spending much time in the room, this is a great place. The proximity to the metro station is a big plus. Tip: There is a coffee shop (Picardo Café) immediately across the street from the hotel that you can get free wi-fi. The hotel charges for it. Also, there is a place called “Club 7” nearby that had some decent nightlife. Luke Mejares was there the night I showed up.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai experience”
Reviews.Author: NitinGujarathi
Reviews.Content: Very good service, good food . Nice rooms . Very good location for tourist . Just across the burjuman complex with easy access to Kalid Bin Waleed metro junction makes you wonder easily in the city . On top of it very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “moon valley hotel apartment”
Reviews.Author: deepakpsonu
Reviews.Content: food is not up to the standard.view is good. but room service is poor. The sound from one room disturbs peoples in other room.although swimming pool is big.but over all make vacation terrible

Reviews.Title: “A Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asadjansari
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in the heart of the business district on Khalid Bin Al Waleed Road. It's a two minute walk from the metro station by the same name and is a 10 minute drive from the airport. Moon Valley is an apartment hotel. Rooms are comfortable and spacious. They provide a kitchenette with microwave, heating plate, cutlery and other items you may require if you want to cook something. Ironing board and iron are available upon request. Provide a daily change of linen and fresh towels as well as the toiletries. Upstairs on the terrace is a small swimming pool and a gym. The staff, although slow at times, is very cordial and very helpful. Rooms service is ok but the food sucks. Specially the buffets. Same menu everyday without a hint of the slightest change. Boiled eggs, chicken sausages, cereals and cornflakes are the mainstream menu items. Started having breakfast at Burjuman Mall opposite the hotel which is not even a 5 minute walk. Wi-Fi Internet is available but for a price. The hotel is good for business travelers but not recommended for families with children. Proximity is the biggest advantage with this hotel. Bus stop, Metro Station, Mall; all within a radius of two minute walks.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need it's here!”
Reviews.Author: dara2838
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff , roof top swimming pool which I loved it, I strongly recommend this hotel apartment to everybody. It came in handy the small kitchen in the room and also the room rate was quite cheap for a hotel in Dubai .

Reviews.Title: “We found it nicely located and suitable for family at reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Shyam057
Reviews.Content: We booked directly with them through email, rooms are neat & clean and sufficient for short trips. The location we liked the most near to metra station. I suggest to carry copies of all the pior correspondance while going to this apartment to avoid any misunderstanding later while checking out. Quality of breakfast need slightly improvement as such can not be called bad.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbuggers?”
Reviews.Author: hanu111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our vacation. Everthing was ok, I don't usually complain from things. This time I just want to warn about bedbuggers which there was. I Didn't saw any but a got buggersbits. There wasn't so meny of them conclude from amounts of bits. No we are nervous did we get those little thing to our home....

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: JessicaDubai
Reviews.Content: its not worth that price. In addition, the employees are not well trained enough. Everyone has a different price to quote for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: naeem3002
Reviews.Content: very nice location, very good family hotel, very cooperative hotel staff, i perfer to stay in moon valley hotel when i will visit again to duabi mohammad naeem minhas - kuwait

Reviews.Title: “nice location , good service”
Reviews.Author: ashishb2
Reviews.Content: the holtel is located at very centre place near to shopping mall more important METRO is very near the room chg are very low and rooms are very good . the breakfast is very good and lots of verity

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel With Good location”
Reviews.Author: holiday-yer
Reviews.Content: Day we checked in , airconditioning wasn't working properly, they fix then bathroom start leacking from roof, room service is avarage. but location is very good. hotel is right next to metro station and burjaman centre and mina bazar, alot of banks u can find near hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: solodrifter
Reviews.Content: i Like this hotel because it is located near the less than a 5 minute walk to the metro, and less than a 2 minute walk from the bus line. It is behind a major road in which i am unsure of the streets name. Breakfast was included in the price of the hotel. I was surprised at the hotels restaurant because it offered good prices and the quality of the fod was not bad. The draw back was the hot water took a long time before it even would get warm.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place ............”
Reviews.Author: OgyJakarta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year, it is good....not expensive, the room is big ....and clean, the staff is helpful ...a little far from the town but it's ok.. the staff will help you for a taxi .....but not every taxi driver know the location...so it' s better to show the address card to the taxi driver...

Reviews.Title: “Not recomanded”
Reviews.Author: khalid606
Reviews.Content: I stayed here becouse I had a training course neraby. the hotel is smelly, and old. but it's clean. also there no hot water in the bathroom. I don't recomanded this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in the lower price bracket”
Reviews.Author: DublinEmma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room which was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in the cheaper price bracket for Dubai and it is relatively central. Although, like every other hotel, you have to get taxis to where ever you want to go. Breakfast was included in the price but it was awful! There's a small roof top swimming pool which was ok. All in all it was an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear”
Reviews.Author: GaryJordan
Reviews.Content: We were put in here by Emirates having missed our connection. I've stayed in better hotels in deep China and that's saying something. Was asked to sign for meals we didn't have (maybe so Emirates could be charged)? We didn't have two meals. One because there was nothing left, the other it was inedible. Had an argument on the way out with reception manager about the mini bar bill.

HotelInfo.Name: Moon Valley Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Bur Dubai, Khalid Bin Waleed Road, Behind Business Centre | PO Box 113696, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
